title: The Elevator Music Menace
setting: Skyridge Tower, building management office, Wednesday 8 AM
premise: Someone reprogrammed the elevator music system to play 'Never Gonna Give You Up' on repeat. The building manager's computer is the only way to change the playlist, and it requires a login.

suspects.name: Kyle Barrett
suspects.motive: Known prankster who rickrolled the company Slack channel twice last month
suspects.alibi: I left the office at 5 PM Tuesday and went to my kickboxing class from 6 to 7 PM. The gym has my check-in record. After that I went home and stayed in.

suspects.name: Meg Thornton
suspects.motive: Frustrated that her request to upgrade the elevator speakers was denied
suspects.alibi: I was on call Tuesday night but stayed home. I got one maintenance call at 9 PM about a stuck window on the fourteenth floor, which I handled by phone.

suspects.name: Jerome Price
suspects.motive: Bored on the night shift and wanted something entertaining to listen to on his rounds
suspects.alibi: I started my shift at 10 PM Tuesday and patrolled all night. I don't have the building manager's computer password. I wouldn't even know where to find it.

suspects.name: Ashley Nunes
suspects.motive: The building manager took credit for her playlist curation work
suspects.alibi: I left at 5:30 PM Tuesday. I had dinner with my roommate at 7 PM and we watched TV until 11 PM. I didn't come back to the building.

clues.title: Computer Login Timestamp
clues.content: The building manager's computer shows a login at 8:42 PM Tuesday and a logout at 8:51 PM. The playlist was changed during this nine-minute session.

clues.title: Lobby Camera
clues.content: The lobby security camera shows no one entering the building between 7 PM and 10 PM Tuesday through the main entrance. The only other entrance is the service door, which requires a building staff keycard.

clues.title: Keycard Service Door Log
clues.content: The service door keycard log shows Meg's card was used at 8:35 PM Tuesday to enter and again at 8:55 PM to exit. Meg claims she stayed home all Tuesday night and only handled a maintenance call by phone.

hints.text: The playlist was changed between 8:42 and 8:51 PM. Think about how someone could have entered the building without using the main entrance.
One suspect claims they stayed home all evening. Does the keycard log support that claim?
